column4:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
Add ziti pasta, and cook until al dente, about 8 minutes; drain.
In a large skillet, brown onion and ground beef over medium heat.
Add spaghetti sauce and mushrooms, and simmer 15 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix the sour cream and cottage cheese together until blended.
Butter a 9×13 inch baking or casserole dish.
Layer in the baking dish 1/2 of the cooked ziti.
Pour 1/2 of the meat sauce mixture over the ziti.
Lay the provolone cheese slices over the meat sauce.
Spread the sour cream / cottage cheese mixture over the provolone slices.
Spread the remaining ziti, and top with the remaining meat sauce mixture.
Top with shredded mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes, or until cheeses are melted and top starts to brown.

Use an electric mixer.
Lightly grease two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans.
In a large bowl, beat sugar and vegetable oil blend.
To.
Add in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla, mixing after each addition.
Add in the banana to combine.
Banana and stir.
In another large bowl, whisk together flours, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
Stir flour mixture into banana mixture in 2 or 3 additions until just combined.
Spoon batter evenly into loaf pans.
Gently fold in blueberries.
Fill about 3/4 of the way to the top of each pan.
Preheat oven to 350° F.
Preheat oven.
Toothpick insert into the middle of a loaf.
Or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Bake in oven for 60 – 70 minutes.
Cool loaf pans on wire racks for 10 minutes.
Remove loaves from pans.
Place on racks.
And cool completely.

Pull the leaves off the cauliflower.
Cut the core out in kind of cone shape.
Break the wow or cut the wow regularly in about 1.5 inches.
Put the wow into the steamer insert.
Bring about 1 tbsp water to a boil in a steam pot, cover.
About 1 tbsp water add to about 1 inch of water inserted, cover.
About 1 tbsp water add to about 1 inch of water inserted cover and cook about 1 tbsp water for about 20 minutes (you may poke a paring knife through the stem or you may still feel a little texture in about 1 inch of water inserted ).
Dump about half of the cauliflower into the food processor.
Pour in to about half the cauliflower the nut milk, puree about half the cauliflower until smooth.
Now dump the rest of the cauliflower on top.
The rest of the cauliflower now puree the cauliflower again.
You need to stop, scrape and stir the puree a few times.
Add to the puree the butter, salt, pepper and garlic until smooth.
Smoothly mix about half the cauliflower.
Taste the cauliflower pure to season.
If you do n’t eat immediately, you can reheat the dear purée on the same pan over low heat.
Serve the purée hot.

Using a paddle attachment, beat butter, cream cheese, light brown sugar, granulated sugar, and vanilla extract until mixture becomes light and fluffy.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
Add eggs one at a time, making sure to incorporate fully.
Add dry mixture one at a time until mixed.
Make sure the eggs are fully incorporated, scrape down the sides as necessary.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Using a cookie scoop, place a tablespoon to 1 1/2 inches apart on parchment paper.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Bake the cookies for 12-14 minutes or until golden.
Remove from oven.
Let cool for 5 minutes.
Transfer to a cooling rack.
Knead dough.
Place the dough in the refrigerator for the best result for overnight or at least 30 minutes.

In a small pan roast separate coriander, cumin, seeds, cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves.
Whenever each one starts to smell the fragrant spices turning onto a plate to cool.
Roast.
Strip out the cards and use only the seeds.
Strip the cards and discard the pods.
Put all in an electric blender.
Blend to a fine powder.
Grate finely the nutmeg.
Mix.
Store in an airtight glass jar with the lid.

Combine yeast, water, salt, oil, and 2 cups flour in the bowl of a stand mixer.
Using the dough hook, mix on speed 2 for about 1 minute.
Add remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until the dough clings to the hook and cleans the sides of the bowl.
(This should take about 2 minutes).
Continue kneading for an additional two minutes.
Place dough in a greased bowl (I often use the stand mixer bowl, which I remove the dough from, grease, and then return the dough to), turning to grease the top.
Cover with a towel or plastic wrap, and place in a warm place to rise for an hour.
This recipe can be divided into 4 pieces to make smaller, thin crust pizzas, or can be divided in half to make 2 larger, medium-thick crust pizzas.
Make pizza according to your favorite directions.

Greas cooker.
Place chicken in a slow cooker.
Top with peppers and carrots.
Combine broth ingredients in separate bowl: orange juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, mustard, garlic salt, and pepper flakes.
Pour over chicken.
Cover.
And cook for 6-7 hours on low.
Remove chicken and veggies from slow cooker.
And keep warm.
Boil sauce.
Take out 1 cup of cooking liquid.
And bring to a boil in saucepan.
Stir together 1 Tbs.
Of orange juice and the cornstarch, add to sauce.
Stir for 2-3 minutes until thick.
Pour over the chicken.
Slice onions.
Top with green onions.
Cook rice.
And serve over rice.

Preheat oil and loaf pan.
Add flour, oat, salt, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, baking powder, and flour, oats to large mixing bowl.
Stir it to combine.
In another mixing bowl, beat eggs with an electric hand mixer.
In another mixing bowl, then add sugar to eggs.
Beat eggs until well combined.
Add oils, yogurt, pumpkin and vanilla to eggs.
To eggs beat eggs to mix well.
Fake mini chips into batter.
Pour eggs into loaf pan.
Insert toothpick in middle.
Bake eggs 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees, and grease loaf pan.

Place chicken, tomatoes, onions, green chiles, and garlic in a slow cooker with enchilada sauce.
Pour water and chicken broth.
Vary cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper, and bay leaf.
Stir in corn and cilantro.
Cover and low.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 4-3 hours.
Brush both sides of the pan with oil.
Cut the pan into strips.
Place on baking sheet.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees C.
Bake until crisp, about 10-15 minutes.
To serve, mix tortilla strips on top of soup.

In a large mixing bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
In a jug measure the milk.
Separate the eggs.
Place the eggs in the bowl of a stand mixer.
Add the yolk and vanilla essence to the milk.
Whisk together.
Pour in flour mixture.
Stir very gently until about combined.
Melt butter.
Stir butter.
Continue to mix very gently until combined.
Beat in egg whites until stiff.
Preheat waffle iron.
Slowly fold in egg whites into the batter.
Scoop the batter in batches onto waffle irons.
Cook the batter according to its directions.
Remove, immediately.
Serve with maple syrup and fruit.

Add the flour mixture and mix on low speed just until blended .
Transfer the dough onto a piece of plastic wrap and wrap tightly .
In a medium bowl , whisk together both flours , the baking soda and salt .
When ready to bake the cookies , preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours , or up to 5 days .
Bake for another 6 to 8 minutes , or until the cookies are dark golden brown .
Line two baking sheets with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat .
Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days .
Bake the cookies for 10 minutes and then rotate the baking sheet .
Let cool for a minute on the baking sheets , then transfer to a cooling rack .
Transfer to the baking sheet.
On a lightly floured surface , roll out the dough and cut into 3-inch squares .
Let cool completely ( they will crisp up as they cool ) .
In a large bowl , combine the butter , brown sugar and honey .

First four ingredient in a large mixing bowl combine well-combined.
Evenly spreading a 9x13 baking dish.
Combine ingredients for the peanut butter bar chocolate topping medium glass bowl.
Melt and in the microwave for 1 minute at a time.
From remove the microwave and stirred until smooth.
Spread of the peanut butter bar base.
Place in the freezer for 15 minutes.
Removes from the freezer.
Cut into individual bars.
The size depending on number of bars like you serve (20-36 bars).
